abstracts.cdata!:
Within a still fragile post-conflict
            context, the Policy Support Project aims at helping the
            Government of the Central African Republic implement its
            reform program supported by the recently approved Fiscal
            Consolidation Credit (FCC), particularly the privatization
            program; articulate its poverty reduction strategy (PRS);
            start rebuilding its statistical infrastructure; strengthen
            the management of the promising mining sector; and further
            strengthen the technical committee in charge of the reform
            program. There are five main project components. The first
            provides technical assistance to implement the privatization
            and regulation program supported by the FCC. It supports the
            Privatization Commission, revamps the legal and regulatory
            framework, privatizes the management of the state-owned
            electricity company, funds follow-up activities to the
            privatization of the state petroleum company, and privatizes
            the state telecommunications company. The second component
            furnishes technical assistance to help prepare the poverty
            reduction strategy which includes updating the poverty note
            as well as diagnostic studies on public health, education,
            rural transportation, the cotton sector, the livestock
            sector, forestry, and mining. The third component supports
            the technical committee for structural adjustment (CTP-PAS).
            The fourth component supplies technical assistance to start
            implementing the statistical development plan. The fifth
            component strengthens the mining ministry.
